name: battery production, NiMH, rechargeable, prismatic | battery, NiMH, rechargeable, prismatic | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/6886/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of a NiMH battery for laptop applications. It is based on a NiMH battery package as used in a Fujitsu-Siemens laptop, model: C4135 and on  the assumption that a typical such NiMH battery has a weight of 0.591 kg. Main data are taken from an environmental report of a battery producer as well as from literature. In addition own measurements of sizes and weights of batteries were used.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]



(Raw) materials, infrastructure, transport efforts, energy consumption and waste disposal for the production of a NiMH battery. No emissions to air or water are taken into account.
category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This module relates to the global situation (electricity consumption according to the main producing countries).
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Construction details as described for NiMH-rechargable batteries and manufacturing conditions as documented in the environmental report were adopted.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=GLO
The battery package consists of only one large sized battery cell. Technologically a battery cell consists of a multilayered assembly of coats sandwiched to each other and wound eiter circular or prismatically around a virtual axis. The size of this wound layer assembly is specified based on approximations for single cell layer assembly as contained in a LiIo rechargable battery.
The mass of the entire multilayer cell assembly of the considered reference NiMH rechargable battery package is approximated based upon size approximations for the above noted LiIo battery model and is made as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (LiIo rechargable battery): 100.00 mm
Cell layer assembly width (LiIo rechargable battery):	60.00 mm
Battery length (LiIo rechargable battery):	128.00 mm
Battery width (LiIo rechargable battery):	77.00 mm
Battery length (NiMH rechargable battery): 138.00 mm
The calculation is then performed as follows:
Cell layer assembly length (NiMH rechargable battery):
100.00 mm / 128.00 mm = 78.125%
138.00 mm *0.781 = 107.81 mm
 Cell layer assembly width (NiMH rechargable battery):
60.00 mm / 77.00 mm = 77.922%
105.00 mm *0.779 = 81.81 mm 
The thickness (i.e. the depth) of the single unwound layer compartments is approximated with 0.15 mm. Accordingly the single layers are dimensioned as follows (W x D x H): 81.81 mm x 0.15 mm x 107.81 mm.
A multilayer package consists of 5 individual layers, namely positive and negative electrode, separator and electrolyte layer. The thickness of the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly is approximated to 13.5 mm. Adopting the above defined thickness for a single layer (0.15 mm), the entire prismatically wound multilayer assembly consists in total of 90 individual layers and 18 windings (with each time 5 individual layers).

flow.name: battery, NiMH, rechargeable, prismatic
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/27:Manufacture of electrical equipment/272:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators/2720:Manufacture of batteries and accumulators

exchanges.description:
Measured and calculated value. A size of (W x D x H): 2.00 mm x 0.00001 mm x 1.00 mm and a density of 8920 kg/m3 are measured.The calculation of the amount is performed as follows:
0.002 m * 0.001 m * 0.0000001 m * 8920 kg/m3 * 12 	= 0.0000021408 kg Cu-contacts / NiMH battery package
0.0000021408 kg * 1 kg / 0.591 kg = 3.622e-6 kg Cu / kg NiMH battery package
EcoSpold01Location=RAS

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Measured and calculated value. A thickness of 1.0 mm and a density of 1240 kg/m3 are measured. The calculation of the amount is performed as follows:
<- 	Surface S = (0.138 m * 0.105 m * 2) + (0.105 m * 0.02 m * 2) + (0.138 m * 0.02 m * 2)  
	S * 0.001 m * 1240 kg/m3 = 0.072 kg PC / NiMH battery package
	0.071982 kg * 1 kg / 0.591 kg = 0.0812 kg PC/ kg NiMH battery package

exchanges.description:
Calculated value with estimation, based on literature and own assumptions. It is assumed a thickness of the substrate of 0.1 mm and a density of 8908 kg/m3. The calculation of the amount is performed as follows:
<- (0.138 m * 0.105 m * 0.0001 m) * 2 + (0.105 m * 0.02 m * 0.0001 m) * 2 +  (0.138 m * 0.02 m * 0.0001 m) * 2 * 8908 kg/m3 = 0.0266 kg Ni /NiMH battery package
0.0266 kg * 1 kg / 0.591 kg = 0.058 kg Ni/ kg NiMH battery package

Further references:
Fetcenko M. (2002) Propulsion and industrial Nickel-Metal hydride batteries. In: Handbook of Batteries (ed. Linden D. and Reddy T. B.), 3rd Edition Edition. McGraw-Hill Companies, Inc., New York, Chicago, San Francisco, Lisbon, London, Madrid, Mexico City, Milan, New Delhi, San Juan, Seoul, Singapore, Sydney, Toronto
